definition: rising steeply with a broad flat or rounded front
examples: the bluff banks of the river
stood on the bluffs overlooking the ocean

definition: to deter or frighten by pretense or a mere show of strength

examples: bluff her way in without a ticket
The catcher bluffed a throw to first.

definition: to deceive (an opponent) by a bold bet on an inferior hand
examples: was bluffed out of a winning hand
You can tell when he is bluffing.

definition: a false threat or claim intended to deter or deceive someone : an act or instance of bluffing (see bluff entry 3)
examples: Having … nothing to support his pretensions he decided to put up a bluff.
The agreement had been reached, after weeks of bluff and haggle …
